content: The HTTP page of the spec, in Content Types and encodings , mentions a mime type of application/fhir. Is this actually valid, and if so, what would the returned content be? It isn't listed in three paragraphs up in the known mime types.
I believe you're referring to this bit:
UTF-8 encoding SHALL be used for the mime type application/fhir. This MAY be specified as a MIME type parameter to the application/fhir mime type, but is not required.
that's a general reference to all three variants
That was my expectation, but it isn't great language.
agree. you could create a task to clarify that
